snippet: James S. Alesi, one of four Republicans state senators who voted for same-sex marriage last year, said he would not seek re-election because he did not want a “grueling” primary battle.
abstract: New York State Senator James S. Alesi, one of four Republican senators who voted for same-sex marriage in 2011, costing him support among more conservative voters, says he will not run for re-election.
lead_paragraph: James S. Alesi, one of four Republicans state senators who voted for same-sex marriage last year, said he would not seek re-election because he did not want a “grueling” primary battle.

headline.seo: Republican Senator Who Backed Gay Marriage Won’t Seek Re-election
headline.main: G.O.P. Senator Who Backed Gay Unions Won’t Run
headline.print_headline: Senator Who Backed Gay Unions Won’t Run

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
